https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/dmjjbJlYHOGMRexri2FkJXG5EfM.jpg Death In Gaza is an Emmy-award winning 2004 documentary film about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, opening in the West Bank but then moving to Gaza and eventually settling in Rafah where the film spends most of its time. It concentrates on 3 children, Ahmed (age 12), Mohammed (age 12) and Najla (age 16). Death in Gaza
